body: Hey @Rarst, can you reproduce the issue on https://psalm.dev ?
@Rarst, this doesn't seem to be happening with latest master (checked locally with a clone of your repo and using the specific commit you linked).
The path in the error message suggest you're running this on windows, right?

Can reproduce locally with master that I pulled _right_ now.

Yep, I am on Windows.

>  I pulled right now.

Same here.

> Yep, I am on Windows.

That's one obvious difference between our environments. Here's what I'm getting locally:
```console
$ uname -a
Linux portable-ws 5.4.0-4-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 5.4.19-1 (2020-02-13) x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ php -v
PHP 7.4.3 (cli) (built: Feb 20 2020 12:12:06) ( NTS )
Copyright (c) The PHP Group
Zend Engine v3.4.0, Copyright (c) Zend Technologies
    with Zend OPcache v7.4.3, Copyright (c), by Zend Technologies

$ psalm --version
Psalm dev-master@a2fbfc1c9e506829c9d181b74348467c69231134

$ git co 168a226
HEAD is now at 168a226 Changed download links to native github redirect

$ psalm
Scanning files...
Analyzing files...

░░░░░░E░░░░░░░░░░░░░E░░░░░░░░E░░░

ERROR: UndefinedConstant - src/Formatter/Backtrace_Formatter.php:33:23 - Const WP_CONTENT_DIR is not defined
			wp_normalize_path( WP_CONTENT_DIR ),


ERROR: UndefinedConstant - src/Formatter/Backtrace_Formatter.php:34:23 - Const ABSPATH is not defined
			wp_normalize_path( ABSPATH ),


ERROR: UndefinedConstant - src/Formatter/Hook_Formatter.php:21:23 - Const WP_CONTENT_DIR is not defined
			wp_normalize_path( WP_CONTENT_DIR ),


ERROR: UndefinedConstant - src/Formatter/Hook_Formatter.php:22:23 - Const ABSPATH is not defined
			wp_normalize_path( ABSPATH ),


ERROR: DocblockTypeContradiction - src/Record/Collector/Plugin_Load_Collector.php:39:10 - Found a contradiction with a docblock-defined type when evaluating $plugin and trying to reconcile type 'string' to !string
		if ( ! is_string( $plugin ) ) { // Broken hook input from global.


------------------------------
5 errors found
------------------------------

Checks took 0.68 seconds and used 74.449MB of memory
Psalm was able to infer types for 96.1449% of the codebase
```
Have you tried running with `--debug` or `--debug-by-line` switches?

Same from my local:

```
c:\server\www\dev\wp-content\plugins\laps>ver

Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18363.657]

c:\server\www\dev\wp-content\plugins\laps>php -v
PHP 7.4.1 (cli) (built: Dec 17 2019 19:24:02) ( ZTS Visual C++ 2017 x64 )
Copyright (c) The PHP Group
Zend Engine v3.4.0, Copyright (c) Zend Technologies
    with Zend OPcache v7.4.1, Copyright (c), by Zend Technologies

c:\server\www\dev\wp-content\plugins\laps>psalm-dev --version
Psalm 3.x-dev@a2fbfc1c9e506829c9d181b74348467c69231134

c:\server\www\dev\wp-content\plugins\laps>git checkout 168a226
HEAD is now at 168a226 Changed download links to native github redirect

c:\server\www\dev\wp-content\plugins\laps>psalm-dev
Scanning files...
Analyzing files...

░��░��░��░��░��░��░��░��EE░��░��░��░��E░��░��░��░��░��░��░��E░��E░��░��░��░��░��░��░��░��

ERROR: UndefinedConstant - src\Formatter\Backtrace_Formatter.php:33:23 - Const WP_CONTENT_DIR is not defined
                        wp_normalize_path( WP_CONTENT_DIR ),


ERROR: UndefinedConstant - src\Formatter\Backtrace_Formatter.php:34:23 - Const ABSPATH is not defined
                        wp_normalize_path( ABSPATH ),


ERROR: InvalidDocblock - src\Formatter\Backtrace_Formatter.php:86:2 - Invalid typ' in docblock for Rarst\Laps\Formatter\Backtrace_Formatter::shorten_include
        /**
         *
         * @param string $item Backtrace item.
         *
         * @return string
         *
         * @psalm-suppress PossiblyFalseOperand
         */
        protected function shorten_include( string $item ): string {


ERROR: UndefinedConstant - src\Formatter\Hook_Formatter.php:21:23 - Const WP_CONTENT_DIR is not defined
                        wp_normalize_path( WP_CONTENT_DIR ),


ERROR: UndefinedConstant - src\Formatter\Hook_Formatter.php:22:23 - Const ABSPATH is not defined
                        wp_normalize_path( ABSPATH ),


ERROR: InvalidDocblock - src\Mustache_Cache_FrozenCache.php:21:2 - Invalid type '' in docblock for Rarst\Laps\Mustache_Cache_FrozenCache::cache
        /**
         * Cache and load a compiled Mustache_Template class.
         *
         * @param string $key   Key.
         * @param string $value Value.
         *
         * @return void
         *
         * @psalm-suppress InvalidScalarArgument
         */
        public function cache( $key, $value ): void {


ERROR: InvalidDocblock - src\Record\Collector\Http_Collector.php:68:2 - Invalid t' in docblock for Rarst\Laps\Record\Collector\Http_Collector::http_api_debug
        /**
         * Capture end time of HTTP request
         *
         * @param array|\WP_Error $response HTTP response or WP_Error object.
         * @param string          $type     Context under which the hook is fired.
         * @param object          $class    HTTP transport used.
         * @param array           $args     HTTP request arguments.
         * @param string          $url      The request URL.
         *
         * @return mixed
         *
         * @noinspection MoreThanThreeArgumentsInspection
         */
        public function http_api_debug( $response, string $type, $class, array $args, string $url ) {


ERROR: MissingReturnType - src\Record\Collector\Http_Collector.php:68:18 - Method Rarst\Laps\Record\Collector\Http_Collector::http_api_debug does not have a return type, expecting WP_Error|array<array-key, mixed>
        public function http_api_debug( $response, string $type, $class, array $args, string $url ) {


ERROR: DocblockTypeContradiction - src\Record\Collector\Plugin_Load_Collector.php:39:10 - Found a contradiction with a docblock-defined type when evaluating $plugin and trying to reconcile type 'string' to !string
                if ( ! is_string( $plugin ) ) { // Broken hook input from global.

------------------------------
9 errors found
------------------------------
Psalm can automatically fix 1 of these issues.
Run Psalm again with
--alter --issues=MissingReturnType --dry-run
to see what it can fix.
------------------------------

Checks took 3.58 seconds and used 61.377MB of memory
Psalm was able to infer types for 96.1449% of the codebase
```

> Have you tried running with --debug or --debug-by-line switches?

Not sure what to look for in output? It's quite a bit of stuff.

I suspect the garbled stuff in console is because something leaks in as escape codes, so I tried dumping JSON and got this:

```
{
	"severity"     : "error",
	"line_from"    : 86,
	"line_to"      : 86,
	"type"         : "InvalidDocblock",
	"message"      : "Invalid type 'Rarst\\Laps\\Formatter\\string\r' in docblock for Rarst\\Laps\\Formatter\\Backtrace_Formatter::shorten_include",
	"file_name"    : "src\\Formatter\\Backtrace_Formatter.php",
	"file_path"    : "C:\\server\\www\\dev\\wp-content\\plugins\\laps\\src\\Formatter\\Backtrace_Formatter.php",
	"snippet"      : "\t\/**\r\n\t *\r\n\t * @param string $item Backtrace item.\r\n\t *\r\n\t * @return string\r\n\t *\r\n\t * @psalm-suppress PossiblyFalseOperand\r\n\t *\/\r\n\tprotected function shorten_include( string $item ): string {\r",
	"selected_text": "protected function shorten_include( string $item ): string {\r",
	"from"         : 1785,
	"to"           : 1846,
	"snippet_from" : 1654,
	"snippet_to"   : 1846,
	"column_from"  : 2,
	"column_to"    : 63,
	"error_level"  : 4
},
```

Ok, I can reproduce this if I convert the file in question to use dos line endings:
```console
$ sed -i 's/$/\r/g' src/Formatter/Backtrace_Formatter.php

$ psalm --no-progress --threads=1 --no-cache --output-format=json src/Formatter/Backtrace_Formatter.php | jq -r '.|last'
{
  "severity": "error",
  "line_from": 86,
  "line_to": 86,
  "type": "InvalidDocblock",
  "message": "Invalid type 'Rarst\\Laps\\Formatter\\string\r' in docblock for Rarst\\Laps\\Formatter\\Backtrace_Formatter::shorten_include",
  "file_name": "src/Formatter/Backtrace_Formatter.php",
  "file_path": "/home/weirdan/src/psalm-issues/laps/src/Formatter/Backtrace_Formatter.php",
  "snippet": "\t/**\r\n\t *\r\n\t * @param string $item Backtrace item.\r\n\t *\r\n\t * @return string\r\n\t *\r\n\t * @psalm-suppress PossiblyFalseOperand\r\n\t */\r\n\tprotected function shorten_include( string $item ): string {\r",
  "selected_text": "protected function shorten_include( string $item ): string {\r",
  "from": 1785,
  "to": 1846,
  "snippet_from": 1654,
  "snippet_to": 1846,
  "column_from": 2,
  "column_to": 63,
  "error_level": 4
}
```

I was able to narrow this down to a specific commit, specifically the line 222 change to DocComment.php for #2785: https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/commit/41af71556d3c65ab7a6edd986a84ff51e860c55f.

Filtering out the carriage returns prior to getting the array of lines worked for me (i.e. add `$docblock = str_replace("\r", "", $docblock);` before line 192), but I don't know this codebase well enough to know for sure that doing so would be the right fix.

issue.title: Psalm breaks horribly if line breaks are CRLF

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
### Scenario
I am currently fiddling around a bit with [ubuntu for windows](https://ubuntu.com/tutorials/tutorial-ubuntu-on-windows#1-overview) and I thought psalm would be a great project to work on with this. I installed all composer packages and required PHP extensions and even the suggested `ext-igbinary`.

It took me a few days to realize that this was not the issue, but the fact that I checked out psalm with PHPStorm on windows and was using it in the ubuntu command line. This lead to the line breaks in the code being CRLF (aka `\r\n`) instead of only LF (aka `\n`).

To help debug this I created some examples ( ⚠️ careful, they only break if your linebreaks are CRLF, which is obviously not shown in the code below):

### How to reproduce
code:
```php
<?php

namespace Some\Weird\Space;


class A {
    /**
     * @param string|null $bla
     * @return array{
     *          0: \Some\Weird\Space\A|null,
     *          1: null
     *          }
     */
    public function doSomething($bla): array
    {
        echo '1' . (string)$bla;
        return [null, null];
    }
}

$bla = new A();
$bla->doSomething('2');
```

output:
```
Scanning files...
Analyzing files...

E

' in docblock for Some\Weird\Space\A::doSomething type 'Some\Weird\Space\null
    /**
     * @param string|null $bla
     * @return array{
     *          0: \Some\Weird\Space\A|null,
     *          1: null
     *          }
     */
    public function doSomething($bla): array


------------------------------
1 errors found
------------------------------

Checks took 1.40 seconds and used 117.811MB of memory
Psalm was able to infer types for 100% of the codebase
```

### Expected output
just leaving this here as a reference for the full bug report, and it works fine if the linebreaks are LF only:
```
Scanning files...
Analyzing files...

░

------------------------------
No errors found!
------------------------------

Checks took 1.41 seconds and used 117.818MB of memory
Psalm was able to infer types for 100% of the codebase
```

### Remarks
My guess is that this has something to do with the tokenization going wrong and I have it in the back of my mind that there was some piece of code that I stumbled upon during debugging that was just searching for `\n` and nothing else, which sounds like it could have to do with it, but I could not find it again yet.

That being said, my debugging efforts only led to this guess so far and I can not really put my finger on it as you can probably tell.

Given that nobody else seems to have stumbled upon this so far I wonder if it is even relevant, but if so, I would be happy to dig deeper and find a solution - just let me know! Thanks!

**P.S.:** I almost forgot to add. I was not looking for that problem but when I run `./psalm` on master in this configuration, it throws over 400 errors because of this problem.
